TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed OptionValueType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies whether or not a takes a value, and if it does, whether it's optional or required.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Mono.Options.OptionValueType None = int32(0)

summary.para: If an option takes no value, then the callback function will receive if the value is (e.g. -optionName- was used) and non- if the value is (e.g. -optionName, -optionName+).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Mono.Options.OptionValueType Optional = int32(1)

summary.para: This is specified by providing : after the option name within .
If a value is optional, the callback function will receive value if no value is provided, and will otherwise receive a non- value.
Options with optional values are not "greedy" -- the value must be part of the current argument, e.g. -opt:foo will pass "foo" as the value to -opt, but -opt foo will pass as the value to -opt.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Mono.Options.OptionValueType Required = int32(2)

summary.para: This is specified by providing = after the option name within .

Options with required values are "greedy" -- if the current argument does not contain a value, the next argument will be used as the value, e.g. both -opt:foo and -opt foo will pass "foo" as the value to -opt.
